intro: Cuphea scaberrima, commonly known as the rough cuphea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves and stems, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens in warm climates. Cuphea scaberrima is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
